poem:
"Ode to Lost Beginnings"

In the heart of blight-ridden East, a fertile seed
bricked within sterile walls, suspended, 
overshadowed by the regulator's icy gaze.
Three errors whispered by the clinic's solemn lips;
Sons and daughters of ice, secreted away
in miscarriage of mechanised chill.
Fertility's hand, on the lever of creation,
Now halted, in the thick soup of investigation,
Enforced cessation—an echo of lost beginnings.
